alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna; Wayne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 9:13PM EST until January 11 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New York, including the following county, Sullivan and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike, Susquehanna, Wayne and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 911 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding is occurring on PA 87 in Wyoming county, with the road closed. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Hazleton, Carbondale, Pittston, Honesdale, Matamoras, Tunkhannock, Waverly, Falls, Muhlenberg, Dunmore, Old Forge, Bushkill, Archbald, Dickson City, Moosic, Olyphant, Clarks Summit and Lackawaxen. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
